Title: Human Digital Twin—Enabling Human-Agents Collaboration
Venue: 2021 4th International Conference on Intelligent Robotics and Control Engineering (IRCE)
Abstract summary: Human Digital Twins can enable consistent human-agent interaction in smart environments by observing and learning about human interaction patterns.

Title: The Role of Multi-Agents in Digital Twin Implementation: Short Survey
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the role of multi-agent systems in implementing Digital Twins, but does not address the specific gaps in adapting existing agent communication protocols for dynamic human-digital twin interaction in DERs.

Title: Design and Implementation of a Real-Time Hardware-in-the-Loop Platform for Prototyping and Testing Digital Twins of Distributed Energy Resources
Authors: Jiaxuan Han, Q. Hong, Zhiwang Feng, M. Syed, G. Burt, C. Booth
Abstract summary: The paper presents a real-time simulation and hardware-in-the-loop platform for prototyping and testing digital twins of distributed energy resources.

Title: A Survey of Protocol-Level Challenges and Solutions for Distributed Energy Resource Cyber-Physical Security
Authors: Aditya Sundararajan, A. Chavan, Danish Saleem, A. Sarwat
Abstract summary: This paper reviews protocol-level vulnerabilities, attacks, and solutions for distributed energy resource (DER) cyber-physical security, but does not address adapting agent communication protocols for dynamic human-digital twin interaction.

Title: Interactive protocols for distributed energy resource management systems (DERMS)
Authors: M. Ilić, Rupamathi Jaddivada, M. Korpås
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a novel approach to designing technical and financial protocols needed to support the penetration of distributed energy resources (DERs) through interactive protocols for distributed energy resource management systems (DERMS).

Title: Digital Twins: State of the Art Theory and Practice, Challenges, and Open Research Questions
Authors: Angira Sharma, E. Kosasih, Jie Zhang, A. Brintrup, A. Calinescu
Abstract summary: This paper provides a general overview of the state of digital twin technology, including its key components, successful implementations, and research gaps, but does not specifically address adapting agent communication protocols for dynamic human-digital twin interaction in distributed energy resources.

Title: A Review of Interoperability Challenges and Solutions Towards a Digital Twin of the European Electricity Grid
Authors: S. Diakakis, P. Zlatev, N. Palov, T.I. Maris, A. Santas, M. Papadimitriou
Abstract summary: The paper identifies challenges and gaps in data interoperability and interfaces for the development of a European digital twin of the electricity grid.

Title: Operation Orchestration of Local Energy Communities through Digital Twin: A Review on suitable Modeling and Simulation Approaches
Authors: T. Nguyen-Huu, T. Tran, Minh-Quan Tran, P. Nguyen, J. Slootweg
Abstract summary: The paper reviews modeling and simulation approaches for using digital twins to orchestrate the operation of local energy communities and their integration with the electricity grid.
